# R Graphics

## Exercises

1. Plot a scatter plot of petal width vs petal length from the iris data set. (Recall that in base R, you can access the column for petal width using iris$Petal.Width.)

```{r}
iris %>% ggplot(aes(x=Petal.Width, y=Petal.Length)) + geom_point()

```



2. Add a best fit line to the plot.

```{r}
iris %>% ggplot(aes(x=Petal.Width, y=Petal.Length)) + geom_point() + geom_smooth(method='lm', 
              formula=y ~ poly(x, 1, raw=TRUE))
```


3. Create a box plot of petal width by species and another box plot of petal length by species. Make these plots sit side-by-side.

```{r}
library(gridExtra)
g1 <- iris %>% ggplot(aes(x=Species, y=Petal.Width, fill=Species)) + 
geom_boxplot() +
geom_jitter(width=0.2)
guides(fill=FALSE) 
g2 <- iris %>% ggplot(aes(x=Species, y=Petal.Length, fill=Species)) + 
geom_boxplot() +
geom_jitter(width=0.2)
guides(fill=FALSE) 
g1
g2
grid.arrange(g1,g2,nrow=1)
```



4. Create a scatter plot of petal width vs length and color/change symbol by species.

```{r}
iris %>% ggplot(aes(x=Petal.Width, y=Petal.Length, color = Species, shape = Species)) + geom_point()
```


5. Add best fit lines for each species to this plot. 

```{r}
iris %>% ggplot(aes(x=Petal.Width, y=Petal.Length, color = Species)) + geom_point() + geom_smooth(method='lm', 
              formula=y ~ poly(x, 1, raw=TRUE))
```

6. Save this scatter plot to  a file called "figs/iris_ggplot.png".

```{r}
ggsave('figs/iris_ggplot.png')
```
